question: During packet switching, why might packets arrive out of order at the destination?

answers.a: Because a router deletes some packets
answers.b: Due to variable routing paths taken by packets
answers.d: Because routers only support circuit switching

question: What is the role of sequence numbers in packet switching?

answers.b: To ensure proper reassembly at the receiver

question: Which type of packet switching ensures that all packets arrive in order?
What happens if a packet is lost or corrupted in a packet-switched network?

answers.d: The sender must resend the entire file manually

question: Which statement correctly describes packet switching efficiency?

answers.a: It wastes bandwidth because of fixed path allocation
answers.b: It uses network resources only when needed
answers.c: It is slower than circuit switching in all cases
